intro: Tragia alienata, commonly known as the alien thorn. It is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil, and belongs to the family Malvaceae. The plant is characterized by its spiny stems and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Tragia alienata is adapted to thrive in dry, disturbed habitats and is sometimes considered an invasive species in certain regions.
